perturbation.original_text: 4.2 Newegg shall provide to Allied the Sponsorship Benefits set out in Schedule 3, including paying the Sponsorship Fee as provided in that Schedule. Any value-added, goods and services, or similar tax or duty imposed by any government or tax authority on any Sponsorship Benefit shall be borne solely by Allied.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 Newegg shall provide to Allied the Sponsorship Benefits set out in Schedule 3, including paying the Sponsorship Fee as provided in that Schedule. Any value-added, goods and services, or similar tax or duty imposed by any government or tax authority on any Sponsorship Benefit shall be borne solely by Newegg.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by stipulating that Newegg, instead of Allied, is responsible for paying value-added taxes, which contradicts the initial agreement and creates uncertainty about financial obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 14.2 Each Party may also terminate the Agreement for convenience after Contract Year 2 (as defined in Section 14.4) by providing written notice to the other Party at least sixty (60) calendar days prior to the effective date of such termination
perturbation.changed_text: 14.2 Each Party may also terminate the Agreement for convenience after Contract Year 2 (as defined in Section 14.4) by providing written notice to the other Party at least thirty (30) calendar days prior to the effective date of such termination
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the notice period required for termination from 60 days to 30 days, creating uncertainty about the correct procedure for ending the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 14.6 Upon termination for any reason, Newegg shall, without prejudice to its other rights, be immediately discharged of all obligations to pay any further Sponsorship Fees not yet rendered or to provide any further Sponsorship Benefits that have not already been delivered to Allied. Further, if Sponsorship Fees have been paid in advance, the Sponsorship Fee shall be prorated through the date of termination and Allied shall refund the portion corresponding to the unused period of the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.6 Upon termination for any reason, Newegg shall, without prejudice to its other rights, be immediately discharged of all obligations to pay any further Sponsorship Fees not yet rendered or to provide any further Sponsorship Benefits that have not already been delivered to Allied. Further, if Sponsorship Fees have been paid in advance, Allied shall retain all such fees, regardless of the termination date.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by stating that Allied retains all pre-paid sponsorship fees upon termination, regardless of the termination date, directly conflicting with the initial clause of prorating and refunding the unused portion. This introduces significant financial uncertainty.
